result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick Jean Kyles Jr in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Patrick Jean Kyles Jr. Court reviews charges/penalties thereof. Court examines defendant as to waiver of preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause, and binds matter over for trial. State files information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
22R 003272  Bond posted at Sheriff's Office on 3/23/2022.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license or occupational license and within the restrictions thereof. Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No firearms unless he has a concealed carry permit.

1:17 PM Defendant Patrick Jean Kyles Jr appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Adam Gerol in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for PD, defense waives reading of complaint. State recommends $2500 cash bail. Court orders $2500 cash bail w/conditions. Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
